# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:
  
* Name: `bmi`
* Label: `Body Mass Index calculated as weight (kg)/height(m)^2`
* Type of variable: `countinous`
* Missings: 
    + `991 = CAPI/interviewer error`
    + `992 = Impute`
    + `993 = Disable to measure`
    + `994 = Not attempt/not done`
    + `995 = Does not answer`
    + `996 = Not applicable`
    + `997 = Refuse`
    + `998 = Do not know`
    + `999 = Missing`
* Comments: `the BMI variable should be created by dividing weight and heigh variables with the following equation= weight (kg)/height(m)^2.`

# Data process

### 10/66 - Cuba - Wave 1 

There is no varibale. 



### 10/66 - Cuba - Wave 2 

#### Study-specific variables

The study-specific variable elected to be harmonised is:

* Name: `f_WEIGHT`
* Label: `Weight in kilograms`
* Type of variable: `countinous`

* Name: `f_HEIGHT`
* Label: `height (cms)`
* Type of variable: `countinous`


```{r assign_cuba2}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_cuba_w2_bmi','10-66.1066-Cuba-Followup',
                         variables=list('f_WEIGHT', 'f_HEIGHT'), missings = TRUE)
```

```{r local_cuba2}
t1066_cuba_w2_bmi <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_cuba_w2_bmi')

Continuous_summary(var = t1066_cuba_w2_bmi$f_WEIGHT, missing_values = NA)
ggplot(t1066_cuba_w2_bmi, aes(f_WEIGHT)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab("Weight") + ylab("Frequency")

Continuous_summary(var = t1066_cuba_w2_bmi$f_HEIGHT, missing_values = NA)
ggplot(t1066_cuba_w2_bmi, aes(f_HEIGHT)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab("Height") + ylab("Frequency") + xlim(100,200)
```

There are individues with weight values 0 and 9 that are going to considered as mitakes and will be car::recoded as 999. Furthermore, there are individuals with weight values 669, 678, 781 and 999.9 that are going to be considered as mistakes and they will be car::recoded as 999. 

#### Harmonisation algorithm
The harmonized variable will be calculate from the study-specific variables using this formula

bmi=weight/height^2

The missing values have to be car::recoded as follows:

* `NA as 999`

R code of the ALGORITHM:

```{r harmo_cuba2}
t1066_cuba_w2_bmi$weight <- car::recode(t1066_cuba_w2_bmi$f_WEIGHT, "c(0,9)=NA; c(669, 678, 781,999, 999.9)=NA")


t1066_ds_cuba_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_cuba_w2_bmi$id)
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$bmi <- car::recode(round(t1066_cuba_w2_bmi$weight /(((t1066_cuba_w2_bmi$f_HEIGHT)/100)^2), 3), "NA=999")
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$bmi <- labelled(t1066_ds_cuba_w2$bmi, labels = c("Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not attempt not done"=994, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not applicable"=996, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Statistics of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_cuba2}
Continuous_summary(var = t1066_ds_cuba_w2$bmi, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))
ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w2, aes(bmi)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab("BMI") + ylab("Frequency") + xlim(10,80)
```

#### Validation
There is an unusual value that is lower than 12:
```{r crosstabulation_cuba2}
t1066_cuba_w2_bmi$bmi <- t1066_ds_cuba_w2$bmi
t1066_cuba_w2_bmi[which(t1066_cuba_w2_bmi$bmi<13),]
```

```{r local_RM2}
ggplot(t1066_RM_w2_bmi, aes(f_WEIGHT)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab("Weight") + ylab("Frequency")

Continuous_summary(var = t1066_RM_w2_bmi$f_HEIGHT, missing_values = NA)
ggplot(t1066_RM_w2_bmi, aes(f_HEIGHT)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab("Height") + ylab("Frequency") + xlim(100,200)
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
The harmonized variable will be calculate from the study-specific variables using this formula

bmi=weight/height^2

The missing values have to be car::recoded as follows:

* `NA as 999`

R code of the ALGORITHM:

```{r harmo_RM2}
t1066_RM_w2_bmi$weight <- car::recode(t1066_RM_w2_bmi$f_WEIGHT, "999=NA")

t1066_ds_RM_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_RM_w2_bmi$id)
t1066_ds_RM_w2$bmi <- car::recode(round(t1066_RM_w2_bmi$weight /(((t1066_RM_w2_bmi$f_HEIGHT)/100)^2), 3), "NA=999")
t1066_ds_RM_w2$bmi <- labelled(t1066_ds_RM_w2$bmi, labels = c("Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not attempt not done"=994, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not applicable"=996, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Statistics of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_RM2}
Continuous_summary(var = t1066_ds_RM_w2$bmi, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))
ggplot(t1066_ds_RM_w2, aes(bmi)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab("BMI") + ylab("Frequency") + xlim(10,80)
```
